descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from onboarding to active participation.
The skill up flow increases experienced contributors by advancing members who have mastered initial project skills.
The promotion rate flow increases experienced contributors by recognizing and advancing capable members.
The promotion rate flow increases core developers by elevating experienced contributors who demonstrate leadership.
Implicit knowledge transfer accelerates skill development through direct mentorship and collaborative problem-solving.
Implicit knowledge transfer increases promotion rates by preparing contributors for more advanced project roles.
More core developers increase mentorship capacity and implicit knowledge transfer opportunities.
Explicit knowledge transfer accelerates skill development by providing accessible documentation and guides.
An initial pool of potential contributors provides the source for new project members.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential flow of individuals developing skills.
A larger core developer group can increase turnover due to burnout or competing opportunities.
More experienced contributors increase the promotion rate flow by providing a larger candidate pool for advancement.
